item.title: Report E-2024060681
item.description:
Report E-2024060681

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-01T15:12:44+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-19
  • City: ARLINGTON
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS, INC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On June 19, 2024, one (1) 55-gallon drum of paint was punctured by a forklift and released approximately twenty (20) gallons of paint to the trailer interior and pavement beneath. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Enhanced Environmental & Emergency (E3) to remediate the impacted site. E3 personnel deployed granular absorbents to the paint-impacted trailer and swept them in with hand tools. One damaged drum of UN1263 was containerized in one (1) 95-gallon over pack drum, and all spent absorbents were collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum. All waste was left onsite.

item.description:
Report X-2024061651

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-01T15:12:44+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-14
  • City: MEMPHIS
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident

  • Carrier/Reporter: Federal Express Corporation
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: A fiberboard box with signs of a release was discovered during sort operations at the MEMH facility. The fiberboard box contained metal cants in plastic bag with vermiculite. The lid on one the cans opened up and spilled it's contents in the box. All contents were placed into a steel salvage package and a new declaration will be obtained for movement.

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0

  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: A fiberboard box was discovered with signs of release during sort operations at the MEMH facility. The fiberboard box contained twenty six glass bottle packaged with a fiberboard divider and sheets of bubble wrap for dunnage. Four of the glass bottles were broken spilling the contents inside of the fiberboard box. All contents were placed into a steel salvage package and a new declaration will be obtained for movement.

item.title: Report X-2024061059
item.description:
Report X-2024061059

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-28T18:14:46+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-17
  • City: MURFREESBORO
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Hazmat UN1139 was unloaded in the small unload and van scanned to WA 271 at 6:21AM. The package wasn't noticed to be wet or leaking until the driver inspected the package on his vehicle. Upon the driver's coding, Quality Assurance was immediately notified of the wet package placed in plastic bags to contain the spill. Upon external inspection, The package was wet, had a strong odor, and labels were faded from the liquid. After the tracking number was identified, the internal inspection began. 1 gallon of coval ultimate top coat gloss was leaking due from pressure on the cap and 1 quart of the flammable liquid coating solution leaked out. 3 quarts still remain intact in the 1 gallon plastic bottle. The fiberboard box, plastic bottle containing the coating solution, and the plastic bags were placed securely in a hazardous materials bag and then inside a salvage drum. There was no inner packing materials to lessen the pressure on the cap of the coating solution to prevent the lid from loosening.

  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident

  • Carrier/Reporter: Federal Express Corporation
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: A fiberboard box with signs of release was discovered during sort operations at the MEMH facility. The fiberboard box contained ten glass bottles that were packed in plastic bags with bubble wrap and Styrofoam packing peanuts for dunnage. Two of the glass bottles were broken spilling the contents inside of the fiberboard box. All contents were placed into a steel salvage package and a new declaration will be obtained for movement.

item.title: Report X-2024061410
item.description:
Report X-2024061410

  • City: MEMPHIS

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: A fiberboard box was presented to the MEMH spill office with an odor. While investigating the shipment the spill agent discovered a release of the contents. The box contained 1 small oblong box, 2 plastic bottles, and 1 metal can. Vermiculite was used for dunnage. The box, bottles, and can were enclosed in a single clear Ziploc bag. All contents were placed into a steel salvage package and a new declaration will be obtained for movement.

  • Description: A fiberboard box with signs of release was found during sort operations at the MEMH facility. The fiberboard box contained two metal cans packaged in plastic bags and had packing paper for dunnage. On of the can was dented causing the lid to open up and spill the contents. All items were placed into a steel salvage package and a new declaration will be obtained for movement.

item.title: Report E-2024060530
item.description:
Report E-2024060530

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-26T15:13:47+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-21
  • City: NASHVILLE
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 4500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal NNA experienced a release from a 220-gallon metal tote. The tote was shipped as empty with residual material in it. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 1 cup of product released to a 1’ x 6” area of the concrete dock due to a loose valve. The contractors tightened the valve which was re-secured for shipment on. The impacted cardboard and rags were collected into a 5-gallon poly pail. The waste was stored onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report E-2024060506
item.description:
Report E-2024060506

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-26T15:13:47+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-14
  • City: ARLINGTON
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On June 14, 2024, one (1) 50-pound bag of UN3378 was torn while loading and released approximately fifteen (15) pounds of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Mid-South Environmental Services (MSES) to remediate the impacted site. MSES personnel utilized absorbents and hand tools to remediate the UN3264-impacted trailer. All waste was collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon poly vented drum and staged on site for transport and disposal.

  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO-NKX contacted ERTS to report a spill of about 5 gallons of WWM Industrial Paint Remover from one 5gal poly pail onto the dock and trailer floors. The pail was punctured by a forklift at NKX. ERTS will dispatch a contractor to assist with the spill as the material is a regulated corrosive. The terminal has deployed absorbents to the spilled material to prevent further migration.
